citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee is not following the guidance in the program of vet care regarding weekly communication for weights. The
agreed upon program of vet care states that the facility will observe and communicate about the animals daily on a
specified vet report through a shared drive, it further states that weekly weights of the animals will be included on the
reports. The facility states the scale broke and the last recorded and documented weights were on July 28, 2023, at the
home site. These are three smaller female sea lions and managing diet and weights are important to ascertain health
while traveling for several months, especially in a performance environment. This needs to be addressed to assure the
attending veterinarian has the information she requires for adequate authority in the animal’s care while on travel status.
The facility purchased a replacement scale by the end of the inspection process but this will not be corrected until weights
are taken and info is provided to the veterinarian.
Correct by: Sept 5, 2023
This inspection was conducted on the Hawaii Unit located at the New York State Fair in Syracuse, NY.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspector: Dr. Jason Sifkarovski, Veterinary Medical Officer
